items.q: In which sport might you execute a 'Fosbury Flop'?
items.explanation: Dick Fosbury popularized this revolutionary backwards high-jumping technique in the 1968 Olympics.

items.q: The core objective in the sport of curling is to slide stones closest to the center of a target called the 'house'.
items.explanation: Points are scored for every stone resting closer to the center than the opponent's closest stone.

items.q: In field hockey, players are allowed to use both sides of their stick to hit the ball.
items.explanation: Players may only use the flat side of the stick to touch or hit the ball.

items.q: What is the collective term for the three races that make up the prestigious 'Triple Crown' of thoroughbred horse racing in the US?
items.a: The Kentucky Derby, the Preakness Stakes, and the Belmont Stakes.
items.explanation: Winning all three in a single season is considered one of the rarest feats in sports.

items.q: In standard Major League Baseball, how many outs does a team get per inning collectively?
items.explanation: Each team gets three offensive outs per half-inning.

items.q: Which combat sport translates directly to 'empty hand' in Japanese?
items.explanation: It is predominantly a striking art using punching, kicking, knee strikes, and elbow strikes.

items.q: What is the designated area extending from the baseline to the 10-foot (3m) line in volleyball called?
items.explanation: Players in the back row cannot legally attack the ball effectively if they take off in front of the 3-meter line.

items.q: In fencing, which of the three weapons specifically targets only the opponent's torso with the tip?
items.explanation: The épée targets the entire body with the tip, while the sabre targets above the waist with both edge and tip.

items.q: What is a 'hat trick' in ice hockey or soccer?
items.a: When a single player scores three goals in a single game.
items.explanation: In hockey, fans traditionally throw hats onto the ice to celebrate.

items.q: What event natively combines cross-country skiing and rifle shooting?
items.explanation: It requires immense cardiovascular endurance immediately followed by steady, precise marksmanship.
